Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor     Treatment of inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor may include the following:               -  Surgery to completely remove the tumor when possible.      -  Chemotherapy.       -  Steroid therapy.       -  Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) therapy.      -  Targeted therapy (ALK inhibitors).      - A clinical trial of targeted therapy, radiation therapy, and surgery with or without chemotherapy.
